bcl:section.bcl:text: An application for a community forest agreement under section 43.2 (1) of the Act must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be made to the minister,
be in the form and manner required by the minister, and
include the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a description of the Crown land proposed for inclusion in the community forest agreement area, if the Crown land was not described in the advertisement;
a description of any private land or first nation reserve land proposed for inclusion in the community forest agreement area;
a business plan acceptable to the minister that includes the following:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: a description of the legal entity that will hold the agreement;
the governance model for the agreement, including the structure and mandate of the management board or persons who will direct operations under or in respect of the agreement;
an analysis of the markets for products harvested under the agreement;
an assessment of the events or circumstances that may compromise the ability of the holder of the agreement to successfully implement the business plan;
financial statements respecting financing, if any, forecasts for profit and loss, cash flow and capital expenditures and a listing of capital assets;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a plan for the management of forest resources on the proposed community forest agreement area, including

bcl:clause.bcl:text: a proposed allowable annual cut for the community forest agreement area;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: documentation of community awareness and support for the proposed community forest agreement, including a summary of the submissions received during, and the results of, a public review of the application conducted by the applicant;
other information required by the minister to the extent the information is relevant to the application.

bcl:section.bcl:text: An application under section 3 must be evaluated by considering the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: whether the proposed community forest agreement area is considered suitable for a community forest agreement;
whether the proposed business plan, if implemented, would provide the applicant with a reasonable chance of operating successfully from a business perspective;
whether the application documents community awareness and support for the proposed community forest agreement;
whether the proposed plan for the management of forest resources

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is suitable for managing the resources known to be present on the community forest agreement area,
is appropriate to achieve the goals of the community and the government with respect to forest resource management, and
is consistent with the proposed business plan;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: whether the proposed governance model for the community forest agreement will ensure that operations under the community forest agreement are conducted in a manner that provides for meaningful input from the community and stakeholders;
the results of a public review of the application, including any actions taken or proposed to be taken by the applicant in response to concerns raised during the public review;
whether entering into a community forest agreement would be in the best interest of the community and the public;
any other information provided by the applicant as required by the minister.
